meanings.definition: A person or company that provides a warranty for a product or service.
meanings.sent1: The warrantor of the phone promised it would be fixed for free.
meanings.sent2: The warrantor of the car assured us it had a warranty for five years.
meanings.sent3: The warrantor of the toaster must have been confident it wouldn't break.
meanings.sent4: She acted as the warrantor of happiness in our office, always ensuring smiles.
meanings.sent5: The warrantor of the umbrella made sure it wouldn't leak in the rain.
